item.title: A system for ephemera and eternit√†
item.description: I’ve been thinking about how to organize and share my thoughts for many years. Having spent a period of time thinking about this is not uncommon; I find some comfort in that I’m not the only one out here with a wasteland of discarded blogs that each went strong for maybe 3 months.

item.title: Abstract design theory
item.description: I’ve been taking Sinix Design’s abstract design theory course online through Brainstorm School. The course goes through how to analyze aesthetic fundamentals and apply that to paintings, which is important for [[training intuition]] on how to make art that looks good and communicates intent.

item.title: Barriers to entry
item.description: Barriers to entry are common in many hobbies, professions, markets, social circles, and other physical or virtual spaces. They can be tangible (owned assets, geographic location, physical characteristics) or intangible (knowledge, experience, influence).

item.title: Bitwig studio
item.description: Bitwig studio is a Digital Audio Workstation designed by Bitwig GmbH. Standout features Ableton-style workflow Built-in modulation and automation of any parameter Contains The Grid, which is a full [[modular synthesis]] environment Linux compatible New plugin format (CLAP) Plugin sandboxing (crashed VST plugins will not crash the program)

item.title: Blank canvas syndrome
item.description: Writers, artists, composers, mathematicians.. Everyone knows how terrifying a blank white page looks. The void stares back at you, daring you to desecrate its pure surface.

item.title: Building your village
item.description: Inhabiting the same physical or virtual spaces can cause [[unplanned repeated interactions]]. This often requires a certain level of [[granularity of transportation]].

item.title: Chekhov's gun
item.description: Chekhov’s gun is a theory that an object or piece of a narrative should only be included if it has a purpose.

item.title: Cognitive scaffolding
item.description: Cognitive scaffolding is an educational framework where something helps reduce the cognitive load of a task until the learner is ready to do so without it (I like to think of this as how training wheels help you learn how to ride a bike, or crutches help you start to walk again after an injury).

item.title: Collector's fallacy
item.description: Collector’s fallacy: you really have to work with something to understand it. Knowing about a thing is not the same thing as knowing it.

item.title: Creating to inspire creation
item.description: My main goal in making things is to inspire others to make things, potentially in new ways. Maybe someone will see my paintings and think, “I want to learn how to paint like that!

item.title: Discord
item.description: Originally designed as a low-latency voice chat for gamers, discord has evolved into much more: a multichannel chat platform, a community building program, an education platform, a replacement for the web forums of old…

item.title: Doing quests is more rewarding than grinding skills
item.description: When playing an MMORPG, there are two main ways of leveling up: doing quests and grinding skills. Generally quests and grinding line up to some degree, but not in RuneScape.

item.title: Dunbar's Number
item.description: Dunbar’s number is the theoretical limit to how many people you can maintain a stable social relationship with, commonly pegged to around 150.

item.title: Edge case
item.description: When building models or algorithms, we construct a space which contains the expected behavior and tailor our models to that space.

item.title: Enabling environment
item.description: Andy Matuschak defines an enabling environment as an environment that “significantly expands its participants’ capacity to do things they find meaningful and important”.

item.description: In mathematics, a gradient is a vector pointing in the direction of the steepest descent/ascent. The magnitude of the vector is how steep the slope is, and so the gradient is the vector with the largest magnitude, or in other words the largest change.

item.description: In optimization, a greedy algorithm is an approach that tries to make the most locally optimal decision at each point in time.

item.title: Happy accidents
item.description: We don’t make mistakes – we just have happy accidents. Bob Ross Serendipity can create new scenarios that an experienced person may not have otherwise come up with.

item.title: High skill ceiling
item.description: In video games, a skill ceiling is the limit of ability; how good you could theoretically get at the game. The game of rock, paper, scissors has a relatively low skill ceiling.

item.title: High skill ceilings allow for skill expression
item.description: A [[high skill ceiling]] rewards continuous optimization and innovation. When there is space to try all kinds of things, there are more possibilities for people to express their ability in ways that are unique to them.

item.title: Human labor is hidden behind AI
item.description: Ghost work Automation won’t replace human labor; it will just split what humans currently do into tons of tiny [[living edge case]] that pay a few cents apiece, small enough that handling it won’t count as a “real” job and the wealthy class will never see it happen.

item.title: Living edge case
item.description: Some people have lived a life others cannot believe or comprehend. Aside from Guinness world record holders, someone with a rare disease or extremely niche profession has lived a life that’s very different from that of the average person.

item.description: A vertical slice is a type of MVP in the world of game development, in which the game is fully playable and includes all the necessary features to function as a game.

item.title: Visual library
item.description: A visual library is a mental map of all the objects and images we’ve seen. Information stored in one’s visual library includes what things are, how they function, how they move, what they look like from different angles, their materials and textures, and how their weight is distributed.
